page.title: 09CASTLETOWN -OLRIG FARM
page.content: {Olrig Mains}is a traditional 540 acre farm of which 210 acres are arable.It produces mainly{beef}and{lamb}and grows proven crops such as{barley}and {oats}.This mixed farm carries 250 {cross cattle}and 250{North Country {Cheviot}and{Suffolk Cross sheep}.Crops include 40 acres each of{barley}and {oats},12 acres of{turnips},110 acres of {grass}cut for{silage}and 20 acres cut for{hay},both for winter feed.One additional worker is employed to help the owner whose family have farmed here since 1914.In 1950 8 workers would have been employed and many more at busy times.The farm buildings, floors and walls are built from flagstone}from nearby quarries.An unusual feature for Caithness is the 50 acres of{woodland}which the farmer is successfully regenerating.
